item.title: The Daredevils Without Landlines — And Why Health Experts Are Tracking Them
item.description: May 4, 2017 - It's official: A majority of U.S. homes only have mobile telephones. But who knew wireless-only households were into risky behavior? A Centers for Disease Control and Prevention researcher explains.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - It's official: A majority of U.S. homes only have mobile telephones. But who knew wireless-only households were into risky behavior? A Centers for Disease Control and Prevention researcher explains. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2015/12/03/458225197/the-daredevils-without-landlines-and-why-health-experts-are-tracking-them

item.title: Did You Get A Weird Invitation To Edit A Google Doc? It's Best Not To Click
item.description: May 3, 2017 - The reason: It's probably not legit. A vast phishing scam has been emailing malicious files masquerading as Google Docs. Does a recent edit invitation smell fishy to you? Just delete it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - The reason: It's probably not legit. A vast phishing scam has been emailing malicious files masquerading as Google Docs. Does a recent edit invitation smell fishy to you? Just delete it. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/03/526785635/did-you-get-a-weird-invitation-to-edit-a-google-doc-its-best-not-to-click

item.title: Facebook Plans To Add 3,000 Workers To Monitor, Remove Violent Content
item.description: May 3, 2017 - "If we're going to build a safe community, we need to respond quickly," Mark Zuckerberg wrote Wednesday. The hiring spree comes amid a spate of violent videos uploaded to the site by users.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - "If we're going to build a safe community, we need to respond quickly," Mark Zuckerberg wrote Wednesday. The hiring spree comes amid a spate of violent videos uploaded to the site by users. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/03/526727711/facebook-plans-to-add-3-000-workers-to-monitor-remove-violent-content

item.title: Without A Special Visa, Foreign Startup Founders Turn To A Workaround
item.description: May 3, 2017 - Immigration advocates often tout how many startups are founded by foreigners. Yet the U.S. does not offer startup visas. Some entrepreneurs turn to a program started as an experiment in Massachusetts.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - Immigration advocates often tout how many startups are founded by foreigners. Yet the U.S. does not offer startup visas. Some entrepreneurs turn to a program started as an experiment in Massachusetts. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/05/03/526549402/without-a-special-visa-foreign-startup-founders-turn-to-a-workaround

item.title: Airbnb Settles Suit With San Francisco, Aims To Smooth Host Registration
item.description: May 1, 2017 - The short-term rental company has had an occasionally fraught relationship with its city of origin. But this lawsuit — which was joined by HomeAway — ended in an agreement lauded Monday by both sides.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - The short-term rental company has had an occasionally fraught relationship with its city of origin. But this lawsuit — which was joined by HomeAway — ended in an agreement lauded Monday by both sides. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/01/526421009/airbnb-settles-suit-with-san-francisco-aims-to-smooth-host-registration

item.title: Environmentalists, Coal Companies Rally Around Technology To Clean Up Coal
item.description: May 1, 2017 - The industry has been in decline for years, partly because burning coal creates CO2 and warms the atmosphere. But there's a way to capture it — which has drawn praise from traditional enemies.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - The industry has been in decline for years, partly because burning coal creates CO2 and warms the atmosphere. But there's a way to capture it — which has drawn praise from traditional enemies. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/01/524764617/environmentalists-coal-companies-rally-around-technology-to-clean-up-coal

item.title: 'It Is Neither Nor, It Is Both': Tom Hanks Finds No Easy Answers In 'The Circle'
item.description: April 30, 2017 - In the film adaptation of Dave Eggers' 2013 novel, Hanks plays Eamon Bailey, co-founder of a giant social media and tech company with the creepy mantra: "Sharing is caring."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 30, 2017 - In the film adaptation of Dave Eggers' 2013 novel, Hanks plays Eamon Bailey, co-founder of a giant social media and tech company with the creepy mantra: "Sharing is caring." http://www.npr.org/2017/04/30/526105460/it-is-neither-nor-it-is-both-tom-hanks-finds-no-easy-answers-in-the-circle

item.title: Turkey Blocks Wikipedia, Accusing It Of Running 'Smear Campaign'
item.description: April 29, 2017 - Wikipedia refused to remove content, leading to the ban. It's the latest in what critics say is a crackdown on free speech.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 29, 2017 - Wikipedia refused to remove content, leading to the ban. It's the latest in what critics say is a crackdown on free speech. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/29/526184731/turkey-blocks-wikipedia-accusing-it-of-running-smear-campaign

item.title: A Primer On The Future Of Net Neutrality Under Trump
item.description:
April 29, 2017 - The Federal Communications Commission is taking steps to repeal regulations for Internet service providers that the FCC approved in 2015.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/04/29/526157951/a-primer-on-the-future-of-net-neutrality-under-trump
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: NSA To Limit Some Collection Of Internet Communication
item.description: April 28, 2017 - The agency will scale back its collection of "about" data, messages that are not only traveling to and from a foreign target, but those that mention one.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 28, 2017 - The agency will scale back its collection of "about" data, messages that are not only traveling to and from a foreign target, but those that mention one. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/28/526092530/nsa-to-limit-some-collection-of-internet-communication

item.title: In 'The Circle', What We Give Up When We Share Ourselves
item.description: April 28, 2017 - The film, based on the book by Dave Eggers, presents a dystopian view of where Silicon Valley is taking the world and captures the tech industry's failure to acknowledge the downside of its creations.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 28, 2017 - The film, based on the book by Dave Eggers, presents a dystopian view of where Silicon Valley is taking the world and captures the tech industry's failure to acknowledge the downside of its creations. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/28/525916707/in-the-circle-what-we-give-up-when-we-share-ourselves

item.title: Survey Says Workers Are Leaving Tech Jobs Because Of Mistreatment
item.description: April 28, 2017 - The tech industry is getting hit hard by turnover among workers who believe they've been treated unfairly. It's most acute among underrepresented workers, including women and minorities.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 28, 2017 - The tech industry is getting hit hard by turnover among workers who believe they've been treated unfairly. It's most acute among underrepresented workers, including women and minorities. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/28/525992223/survery-says-workers-are-leaving-tech-jobs-because-of-mistreatment

item.title: Google Spins Up Its First Servers In Cuba
item.description: April 27, 2017 - The company can speed up delivery of high-bandwidth content like YouTube videos because the servers will now store data locally. But accessing the Internet in Cuba remains difficult and expensive.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 27, 2017 - The company can speed up delivery of high-bandwidth content like YouTube videos because the servers will now store data locally. But accessing the Internet in Cuba remains difficult and expensive. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/27/525896190/google-spins-up-its-first-servers-in-cuba

item.title: Scientists Hunt Hard Evidence On How Cop Cameras Affect Behavior
item.description: April 27, 2017 - Police departments in about 95 percent of cities nationally have put wearable cameras on officers, or soon plan to. But do these body cameras make neighborhoods safer? Scientists want to find out.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 27, 2017 - Police departments in about 95 percent of cities nationally have put wearable cameras on officers, or soon plan to. But do these body cameras make neighborhoods safer? Scientists want to find out. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/27/525081998/scientists-hunt-hard-evidence-on-how-cop-cameras-affect-behavior

item.title: 'Textalyzer' Aims To Curb Distracted Driving, But What About Privacy?
item.description: April 27, 2017 - Police may soon have technology to tell if a driver involved in an accident had been using a mobile device behind the wheel. Privacy advocates worry about letting police snoop on people's phones.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 27, 2017 - Police may soon have technology to tell if a driver involved in an accident had been using a mobile device behind the wheel. Privacy advocates worry about letting police snoop on people's phones. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/27/525729013/textalyzer-aims-to-curb-distracted-driving-but-what-about-privacy
